trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Cluster Orchestration Placement Constraints
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Cluster Orchestration Placement Constraints

trans-unit.source: A conceptual overview of placement constraints in Service Fabric
trans-unit.target: A conceptual overview of placement constraints in Service Fabric

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric allows developers to constrain the placement of service replicas on to nodes that satisfy particular conditions.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric allows developers to constrain the placement of service replicas on to nodes that satisfy particular conditions.

trans-unit.source: These conditions are expressed via a boolean expression that is evaluated with appropriate service-context specific values.
trans-unit.target: These conditions are expressed via a boolean expression that is evaluated with appropriate service-context specific values.

trans-unit.source: By using Placement Constraints, you can:
trans-unit.target: By using Placement Constraints, you can:

trans-unit.source: Confine different type of services on different types of nodes via defining NodeProperties on the nodes.
trans-unit.target: Confine different type of services on different types of nodes via defining NodeProperties on the nodes.

trans-unit.source: Apply certain constraints to primary replicas but not secondary replicas
trans-unit.target: Apply certain constraints to primary replicas but not secondary replicas

trans-unit.source: NodeProperty- A user or system defined map from a string to a value, that can vary over each node, i.e
trans-unit.target: NodeProperty- A user or system defined map from a string to a value, that can vary over each node, i.e
